title: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer told the 'big mistake' he made at Manchester United
text:
Ole Gunnar Solskjaer has been accused of making a ‘big mistake’ at Manchester United (Picture: Getty)

Danny Murphy says Ole Gunnar Solskjaer and Manchester United made a ‘big mistake’ when they let Alexis Sanchez leave in the summer.

Chilean forward Sanchez arrived at Old Trafford in 2018 in a swap deal with Henrikh Mkhitaryan, having enjoyed four productive seasons at Arsenal.

But the 30-year-old struggled under former manager Jose Mourinho and then current boss Solskjaer and Manchester United loaned him out to Inter Milan in August.

The Red Devils have endured a dismal start to the season and Murphy says it was a ‘big mistake’ to allow Sanchez to leave, while also questioning the sale of Romelu Lukaku.

Solskjaer and United allowed Alexis Sanchez to leave on loan (Picture: Getty)

‘Some serious questions need to be asked on how United let both Lukaku and Sanchez leave without being replaced,’ Murphy told Sportingbet.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘There’s next to no strength and depth at the club, so there’s not much they can change.

‘The pressure is starting to pile up on a select few players to deliver and that pressure increase after every loss.

‘It was a big mistake letting Sanchez leave. He hadn’t had a great time at Utd, but I feel Mourinho played a big part in that and this could have been a fresh season for him.

‘He’s not a player that had to prove himself, everyone is aware what he can deliver when firing on all cylinders.

‘In these situations, you need to have your experienced players in the changing room and Utd have lost two big figures in Sanchez and Lukaku, without replacing them.’

Winning just two of their seven league fixtures so far this season, Manchester United find themselves tenth in the Premier League ahead of this weekend’s round of fixtures.

The Red Devils have made a poor start to the season (Picture: Getty)

The Red Devils face Liverpool later in the month and Murphy says Solskjaer could be in ‘a lot of trouble’ if his United team are rolled over by the Premier League leaders.

‘Solskjaer could be in a lot of trouble if Utd take a serious beating from Liverpool after the international break,’ Murphy added.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Every player and member of staff is in the spotlight and every decision and action is being judged. It doesn’t matter who Utd play now, every game is as big as the next.

‘Man Utd need every player fit if they’re to stand a chance of getting some consistency back. Without Pogba, Martial and Rashford all playing at the same time, they look very average.

‘The Liverpool game will shine a light on how much these players really want to turn the club around.

‘Playing Liverpool isn’t just about the 3 points, it’s getting one over your rivals and making a statement.’
